https://prez.dev/description.@value: A categorization of disciplines or topics that the broad field of Earth science can be subdivided into, i.e. a listing of the Fields of Research, or subjects, to which a geoscience dataset, publication, observation/activity, or entity pertains. The vocabulary also contains relevant disciplines that intersect with the various Earth science fields, such as biological sciences and built environment and design, as well as entries related to collection and heritage management. Notations included are those from the 2020 ANZSRC listing (see History Note) or in common use in the geoscience community.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#defi.@value: A subfield of geophysics dealing with the forces and processes of the interior of the Earth. It applies physics, chemistry and mathematics to the understanding of how mantle convection leads to plate tectonics and geological phenomena such as seafloor spreading, mountain building, volcanoes, earthquakes, faulting and so on. It also attempts to probe the internal activities of the Earth by measuring magnetic fields, gravity, and seismic waves, as well as the mineralogy of rocks and their isotopic composition.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#hist.@value: From the Fields of Research vocabulary from the Australian and New Zealand Standard Research Classification (ANZSRC, 2020). Definition adapted from Glossary of geology (5th edition revised; Neuendorf et al., 2011) and Wikipedia.
